e1.name: OCaml
e1.desc: OCaml may be used when you need to write a safe programs (as it is a functional language). It's quite easy to learn, almost no syntax.

e1.name: PHP
e1.desc: Almost everything you will use in PHP to make your website server-side in PHP.

e1.name: Java
e1.desc: The course is explaining a lot of concepts up to Java16, including graphical libraries like SWING, AWT, or JavaFX.

e1.name: C
e1.desc: We start from scratch and end up creating more complex programs with threads or a graphical interface.

e1.name: Cybersecurity
e1.desc: Everything related to the security of your accounts, applications, websites should be kept here.

e1.name: Linux
e1.desc: Learn how to survive in (or mastering) a Linux-based environment.

e1.name: SQL
e1.desc: Course about SQL, PL/SQL, and PGSQL. You will also learn a bit about NoSQL Database with Cypher.

e1.name: NoSQL
e1.desc: Learn about NoSQL with MongoDB and Cypher.

e1.name: Assembly
e1.desc: A short introduction to ARM assembly.

e1.name: Node.js
e1.desc: Learn how you could use node to handle server-side logic, creating an API, or even creating an application with electron.

e1.name: Typescript
e1.desc: Write once and compile in any version of JavaScript.

e1.name: API
e1.desc: An application programming interface (API) is an interface allowing a user to use someone else services without digging into the code.
